name: Radium
description: Radium is a minimalist and physics-based skill game, featuring unique game controls.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 8 / 7 / Vista / XP Processor: 2 GHz Dual Core Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: DirectX 8-compatible graphics card with at least 32MB of video memory DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 30 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c compatible

reviews.review_text: Radium is an extremely fun physics based puzzle game. It can be quite difficult and very challenging completing the puzzles in the shortest amount of time. It controls very well with an XBOX 360 controller. 8/10

My expectations of Radium going in were pretty lackluster. However, after playing through the first 10 or so levels of Radium, what I found is a very cool, unique take on the classic 'Navigate the level and avoid the obstacles' puzzle genre. Easily worth a dollar just to experience the clever control scheme.
This is a physics based game! You have to use lasers to guide the ball to the target. In order to move to the next set of levels you must have a certain amount of points! This game is so addicting!

a very nice physic-y puzzle-E mind boggling-lee fun game. just two simple buttons as translated from the app store game it came from. Left and Right. the twist comes in when gravity gets turned upside down, and left <-> right controls switch, throw in a bunch of neat level \ game modifying franticness like spikes etc and you got a very delight full game.  don't let my playtime fool you i've played it a wee bit in offline
